properties.name: Object ID
properties.description: Placeholder for the ID of the object to block. This will be populated automatically

properties.name: Access Rule
properties.description: Name of the access rule to add objects to

properties.name: observable_type
properties.description: The type of observable pivoted on

properties.name: Webex Room Name
properties.description: The name of the Webex room to post messages to. If using a bot, make sure to invite your bot to the room before attempting to send messages

properties.name: Network Group
properties.description: Name of the network group to add objects to

properties.name: URL Group
properties.description: Name of the URL group to add objects to

properties.name: Object Type
properties.description: Placeholder for the type of the object to block. This will be populated automatically

properties.name: observable_value
properties.description: The value of the observable pivoted on

properties.name: Object Name
properties.description: Placeholder for the name of the object to block. This will be populated automatically

properties.name: Access Control Policy
properties.description: Name of the access control policy to update

properties.name: Object Name Prefix
properties.description: A prefix to preprend to object names generated by this workflow

properties.name: Object Group Type
properties.description: Placeholder for the type of object group. This will be populated automatically

properties.name: Webex Access Token
properties.description: The access token to use to authenticate to the Webex API. Information about using a bot, which is what we recommend, can be found here: https://developer.webex.com/docs/bots

properties.name: Workflow URL
properties.description: Placeholder used to store a link to the workflow's run. This will be populated automatically

This workflow takes a URL, domain, IP, or IPv6 observable as input and blocks it on the Secure Firewall Management Center. The observable is added to a new object and the new object is added to an existing object group. A confirmation is sent via Webex. Supported observables: url, ip, ipv6, domain

Note: There are multiple ways to integrate FMC with SecureX orchestration. Please see the workflow documentation for more information.

Documentation: https://ciscosecurity.github.io/sxo-05-security-workflows/workflows/0065

Target Group: Default TargetGroup

Targets: FMC Target, Webex Teams

Steps:
[] Search for the Webex room
[] Validate required variables
[] Set the object type based on observable type
[] Check if object already exists
[] Check if network or URL objects:
[]> If network:
[]>> Get network group and check if object is already in it
[]>> Add object to the group and send confirmation
[]> If URL:
[]>> Get URL group and check if object is already in it
[]>> Add object to the group and send confirmation

actions.name: Set Variables
actions.title: Update Object ID and Object Name

properties.display_name: Update Object ID and Object Name

properties.script:
#Configure payload for Secure Firewall

import sys
import time
import json
prefix, type_, value_ = sys.argv[1:4]
object_name = f'{prefix}-{type_}Object-{int(time.time())}'

body = {"description": "SecureX Orchestration auto-generated object"}

if "url" in type_:
    body = { "type": "Url", \
    "name": f"{object_name}", \
    "url": f"{value_}" \
    }

if "host" in type_:
    body = { \
    "name": f"{object_name}", \
    "value": f"{value_}", \
    "type": "Network", \
    }

if "fqdn" in type_:
    type_ = type_.capitalize() if type_ == 'Host' else type_.upper()
    body = { \
   "name": f"{object_name}", \
   "type": "FQDN", \
   "value": f"{value_}", \
   "dnsResolution": "IPV4_ONLY", \
   }

body = json.dumps(body)
